title: Remove adult-keyword blocking in MeTube AI Studios prompts

requirements.summary: Remove keyword-based blocking so prompts containing adult/sexual terms (e.g., "sex") do not prevent AI video generation.
acceptanceCriteria: In MeTube AI Studios > Video Generation, entering a prompt that contains the word "sex" does not block generation and does not show the current prohibited-content error toast.
Video generation proceeds normally (subject to authentication and remaining generation time limits) even if the prompt contains previously-blocked keywords.

file_operations.description: Remove the pre-generation hard stop that calls containsBlockedContent(quote) and shows the prohibited-content toast; generation should proceed normally while keeping existing authentication and remaining-time checks intact.

requirements.summary: Update AI Studio content policy UI/copy so it no longer claims generation will be blocked by keyword detection for porn/explicit terms.
acceptanceCriteria: The Video Generation card no longer displays messaging that says prompts will be rejected due to banned keywords.
All updated user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Update the Video Generation card's Content Policy alert copy to remove statements about banned keywords being rejected/blocked; keep copy in English and align it with the updated non-keyword-blocking behavior.
Update any user-facing message helpers (e.g., getContentPolicyMessage/getContentPolicyNote) so they do not claim prompts are rejected due to prohibited terms/keyword detection.

requirements.summary: Adjust the local content policy utility so it no longer implements or exposes a hard-blocking adult/sexual keyword rule for AI generation.
acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer uses the existing blocked-keywords list to prevent AI generation based on adult/sexual terms.
No runtime errors occur from removing/adjusting the content policy helper usage in MeTube AI Studios.

file_operations.description: Remove or neutralize the adult/sexual BLOCKED_KEYWORDS-based detection (e.g., eliminate the list and ensure containsBlockedContent no longer treats words like "sex" as prohibited) while preserving a safe, non-breaking API shape for any remaining imports.
Remove now-unneeded imports/usages of contentPolicy blocking helpers (containsBlockedContent/getContentPolicyMessage) so there are no runtime or build errors after the utility is adjusted.
